title: Enhanced penalties when elderly persons are targeted
context: §444-10.7 Enhanced penalties when elderly persons are targeted. If any person is found to have violated section 444-9 and the violation is committed against elderly persons, in addition to any other penalty set forth or imposed, the court may impose a fine of up to $20,000, or imprisonment up to one year, or both. As used in this section, &ldquo;elderly person&rdquo; means a person who is sixty-five years of age or older. [L 1996, c 172, pt of §2; am L 2014, c 32, §1] Cross References Some other actions or penalties for violations committed against elders, see §§28-94, 412:3-114.5, 480-13, 480-13.5, 485A-603.5, 485A-604.5, and 487-14.
